meanings.definition: Ineptitude or clumsiness in movement or action.
meanings.sent1: Her maladroitness on the dance floor was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His maladroitness in sports made it challenging for him to keep up with his friends.
meanings.sent3: The clown's maladroitness while juggling brought laughter to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The maladroitness of the newborn fawn trying to stand up was endearing.
meanings.sent5: The chef's maladroitness with the knife resulted in a comical vegetable carving.

meanings.definition: Lack of skill or ability in performing tasks.
meanings.sent1: The student's maladroitness in math led to low grades.
meanings.sent2: Her maladroitness in painting made her hesitant to join the art class.
meanings.sent3: The team's maladroitness in the game was unexpected by their coach.
meanings.sent4: The politician's maladroitness in handling the situation caused a public outcry.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter's maladroitness with the hammer resulted in bent nails.
